xwikidoc.name: medsavantArchive20131010
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 10 October 2013
xwikidoc.content: <bvancea_> has joined #medsavant 08:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 09:18 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 11:49 <Jim> has joined #medsavant 12:45 <mfiume> has joined #medsavant 12:45 <mfiume> hey jim 12:45 <mfiume> saw your email 12:45 <Jim^^> hi 12:45 <mfiume> working remotely today 12:45 <Jim^^> ok 12:46 <Jim^^> It looks like annovar uses a very minimal representation for variants 12:46 <mfiume> i didnt quite get this 12:46 <mfiume> "variants uploaded to medsavant can contain surrounding context that affects their position" 12:46 <mfiume> for snps the position is pretty fixed 12:46 <mfiume> no? 12:46 <Jim^^> Well in medsavant, at least with the vcf I have, A variant might be represented like this: 12:46 <Jim^^> Pos Ref Alt Type 12:46 <Jim^^> 63,735 CCTACTA CCTA 12:47 <Jim^^> that would be a deletion 12:47 <Jim^^> whereas in annovar it would be like this: 12:47 <Jim^^> Pos Ref Alt 12:47 <Jim^^> 63,739 CTA 3 12:47 <Jim^^> The first one has surrounding context -- i.e. padding sequence 12:48 <Jim^^> there's similar issues with insertions 12:48 <mfiume> ok so we don't officially support annotation of insertions or deletions 12:48 <mfiume> because of this reason 12:48 <Jim^^> Ah 12:48 <mfiume> its an issue with adherence to the vcf standard 12:48 <Jim^^> Well it wouldn't be hard to fix though would it? Just always represent variants internally using the minimal description 12:49 <Jim^^> i.e. with surrounding context 12:49 <Jim^^> no surrounding context i mean 12:49 <mfiume> ya minimally, no surrounding context 12:49 <mfiume> let's add that as 1.2 priority 12:49 <Jim^^> OK 12:49 <mfiume> it will boil down to doing 1 off conversions 12:50 <mfiume> it may not be simple, bc there's no standard way to represent these really 12:50 <mfiume> but if they're consistent in all the annovar files then we should at least support those 12:50 <Jim^^> True, but annovar will always use a minimal format 12:50 <Jim^^> it's not consistent in the annovar input, but annovar figures it out 12:51 <mfiume> ya, k then it's worth doing at some point 12:51 <Jim^^> Basically, annovar uses these rules 12:51 <Jim^^> 1. If Ref==0, then the reference is not specified. 12:51 <Jim^^> 4. If Ref is a nucleotide sequence and Alt is [0-9]+[A-Z]+, then it is an insertion and deletion (in-del). 12:51 <Jim^^> Did that go through? the phenotips_org just gave me a cryptic error 12:51 <Jim^^> <phenotips_org> Jim^^: An error occurred while executing Wiki IRC Bot Listener [xwiki:IRC.LoggingBotListener]. Check your server logs. 12:52 <mfiume> i got 1-4 12:52 <Jim^^> OK, good 12:52 <mfiume> with errors after that 12:52 <Jim^^> There's only the 4 12:53 <mfiume> ya i think sometimes the position can be different for the same indel 12:53 <mfiume> ex. pos 10 ref actact alt acta 12:54 <mfiume> and pos 11 ref ctact alt ct 12:54 <Jim^^> Can we treat in-dels as a separate insertion and deletion? 12:54 <mfiume> does it handle position issues too? 12:54 <Jim^^> i.e. as two rows? 12:54 <Jim^^> well if we're ignoring insertions, deletions, and in-dels for 1.1, then are there still position issues? 12:54 <mfiume> no an indel is one or the other 12:55 <mfiume> not if we claim we don't officially support their annotation 12:55 <mfiume> then whatever is given is shown in our interface 12:56 <mfiume> if orion is around, ask him to explain more re: position issues, he was the one who showed me the problem 12:56 <Jim^^> I understand how position issues result from insertions, deletions, and indels. 12:56 <Jim^^> In my above example there was one 12:57 <Jim^^> because of the sequence padding 12:57 <mfiume> ya, exactly 12:57 <Jim^^> so that will be something we can resolve for 1.2 12:57 <mfiume> yup 12:58 <Jim^^> OK, so I will need to rerun the annovar scripts I think. Hopefully it will be faster since I'll be skipping insertions, deletions, and in-dels -- and I can try running on compressed filesystems 12:59 <mfiume> why rerun? 12:59 <mfiume> our annotator is programmed to skip indels 13:00 <mfiume> btw do our "position" annotations include an end position? 13:00 <Jim^^> there are some other problems in the input files - I'll see if I can fix them through a quick one off script, if not, I'll re-run. 13:01 <Jim^^> no 13:01 <Jim^^> I omit the end position if it's a position annotation 13:02 <mfiume> are you working on -dev? 13:02 <Jim^^> No I work locally 13:02 <mfiume> ok i may start hammering it soon 13:03 <Jim^^> ok 13:03 <mfiume> importing 1000 genomes data 13:03 <Jim^^> from the annovar files? 13:03 <mfiume> also 13:03 <mfiume> we have very good machines to run important jobs 13:03 <mfiume> the "dupa"s 13:04 <Jim^^> OK, that could help 13:04 <Jim^^> I can parallelize this stuff easily enough, but as-is it's I/O bound 13:09 <mfiume> has left #medsavant 13:12 <sdumitriu1> has joined #medsavant 15:23 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 18:48 <Jim^^> has joined #medsavant 22:32 <Jim^^> has joined #medsavant
